trans-unit.source: For colliders to interact, you need to set their shape in the Property Grid. You can specify a geometric shape, or use a collider shape asset.
trans-unit.target: For colliders to interact, you need to set their shape in the Property Grid. You can specify a geometric shape, or use a collider shape asset.

trans-unit.source: Components can have multiple intersecting shapes, and don't have to match the entity model, if it has one. Each shape has additional properties including size, orientation, offset, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Components can have multiple intersecting shapes, and don't have to match the entity model, if it has one. Each shape has additional properties including size, orientation, offset, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Makes the box infinitely flat in one dimension.
trans-unit.target: Makes the box infinitely flat in one dimension.

trans-unit.source: The box size in XYZ values.
trans-unit.target: The box size in XYZ values.

trans-unit.source: The box position relative its entity.
trans-unit.target: The box position relative its entity.

trans-unit.source: The box rotation in XYZ values.
trans-unit.target: The box rotation in XYZ values.

trans-unit.source: The capsule shape is especially useful for character components, as its curved base lets the entity move to higher planes (eg when climbing staircases).
trans-unit.target: The capsule shape is especially useful for character components, as its curved base lets the entity move to higher planes (eg when climbing staircases).

trans-unit.source: Makes the capsule infinitely flat in one dimension.
trans-unit.target: Makes the capsule infinitely flat in one dimension.

trans-unit.source: The axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).
trans-unit.target: The axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).

trans-unit.source: The capsule position relative to its entity.
trans-unit.target: The capsule position relative to its entity.

trans-unit.source: The capsule rotation in XYZ values.
trans-unit.target: The capsule rotation in XYZ values.

trans-unit.source: The radius of the cone at the bottom end.
trans-unit.target: The radius of the cone at the bottom end.

trans-unit.source: The axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).
trans-unit.target: The axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).

trans-unit.source: The cone position relative to its entity.
trans-unit.target: The cone position relative to its entity.

trans-unit.source: The cone rotation in XYZ values.
trans-unit.target: The cone rotation in XYZ values.

trans-unit.source: Sets the axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).
trans-unit.target: Sets the axis along which the shape is stretched (X, Y, or Z).

trans-unit.source: The cylinder position relative to its entity.
trans-unit.target: The cylinder position relative to its entity.

trans-unit.source: The cylinder rotation in XYZ values.
trans-unit.target: The cylinder rotation in XYZ values.

trans-unit.source: Makes the sphere infinitely flat in one dimension.
trans-unit.target: Makes the sphere infinitely flat in one dimension.

trans-unit.source: The sphere position relative to its entity.
trans-unit.target: The sphere position relative to its entity.

trans-unit.source: The infinite plane covers an infinite distance across one dimension. Think of it like a wall or floor stretching into the distance for ever. You can use several infinite planes together to box users in and stop them "tunneling" outside the level.
trans-unit.target: The infinite plane covers an infinite distance across one dimension. Think of it like a wall or floor stretching into the distance for ever. You can use several infinite planes together to box users in and stop them "tunneling" outside the level.

trans-unit.source: Which vector (X, Y, or Z) is perpendicular to the plane. For example, to make an infinite floor, set the normal property to: X:0, Y:1, Z:0.
trans-unit.target: Which vector (X, Y, or Z) is perpendicular to the plane. For example, to make an infinite floor, set the normal property to: X:0, Y:1, Z:0.

trans-unit.source: The plane position relative to its entity.
trans-unit.target: The plane position relative to its entity.

trans-unit.source: Assigns a collider shape from a collider shape asset (see Collider shape assets below).
trans-unit.target: Assigns a collider shape from a collider shape asset (see Collider shape assets below).

trans-unit.source: The collider shape asset used to generate the collider shape.
trans-unit.target: The collider shape asset used to generate the collider shape.

trans-unit.source: You can also create collider shape assets and use them as your collider shape. This means you can edit the collider shape asset and automatically update it in every entity that uses it.
trans-unit.target: You can also create collider shape assets and use them as your collider shape. This means you can edit the collider shape asset and automatically update it in every entity that uses it.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (bottom by default), click Add asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (bottom by default), click Add asset.

trans-unit.source: Select Physics, then select the shape you want to create.
trans-unit.target: Select Physics, then select the shape you want to create.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio creates the new collider shape asset in the CollisionMeshes folder.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio creates the new collider shape asset in the CollisionMeshes folder.

trans-unit.source: Collider shape asset in Asset View
trans-unit.target: Collider shape asset in Asset View

trans-unit.source: Create a collider shape asset from a model
trans-unit.target: Create a collider shape asset from a model

trans-unit.source: This is useful to quickly create a collider shape that matches a model.
trans-unit.target: This is useful to quickly create a collider shape that matches a model.

trans-unit.source: In the Asset View (bottom by default), click Add asset.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View (bottom by default), click Add asset.

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the model asset you want to create a collider shape asset from and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the model asset you want to create a collider shape asset from and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio creates a collider shape asset from the model.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio creates a collider shape asset from the model.

trans-unit.source: Under the static collider or rigidbody properties, under Collider Shapes, select Asset.
trans-unit.target: Under the static collider or rigidbody properties, under Collider Shapes, select Asset.

trans-unit.source: Next to Shape, specify the collider shape asset you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Next to Shape, specify the collider shape asset you want to use.

trans-unit.source: To do this, drag the asset from the Asset View to the Shape field in the Property Grid. Alternatively, click Hand icon (Select an asset) and browse to the asset.
trans-unit.target: To do this, drag the asset from the Asset View to the Shape field in the Property Grid. Alternatively, click Hand icon (Select an asset) and browse to the asset.
